channel.title: Fezcodex
channel.description: A personal blog by Ahmed Samil Bulbul

Upgrading Debian 11 to 13: The Safe Path

item.title: Steganography: Hiding Secrets in Plain Sight with LSB
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Steganography is the art and science of hiding information within other non-secret data. Unlike cryptography, which scrambles a message so it can't be read, steganography hides the very existence of the message.

Read more...

item.title: The Ultimate Pixel Art Resources Guide
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Pixel art is a beautiful and nostalgic medium that has seen a massive resurgence in recent years, especially within the indie game development scene. Whether you're a seasoned artist or just starting, having the right tools and resources can make a world of difference.

Read more...

item.title: Implementing Drag and Drop in React without Libraries
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
When building Tier Forge, I needed a flexible way to move items between the "pool" and various "tiers". While libraries like react-beautiful-dnd or dnd-kit are excellent, sometimes you just want full control without the overhead.

Read more...

item.title: 5 Ways to Pass Arguments in a URL (Beyond the Basic Query)
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
When building web applications or designing APIs, understanding how to transfer data is crucial. While Query Parameters (the bits after the ?) are the most common method, there are four other fundamental ways to pass arguments to a server via a URL or its associated HTTP request.

Read more...

item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
The Command (PowerShell)

Read more...

item.title: The Corrupted Blood Incident: When a Glitch Taught Us About Pandemics
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Okay, gather 'round, fellow nerds and accidental epidemiologists. I need to talk about something that happened in World of Warcraft back in 2005. It's called the Corrupted Blood incident, and it's basically the coolest (and most terrifying) accidental science experiment in gaming history.

Read more...

item.title: Building the Knowledge Graph: Visualizing Fezcodex in 3D
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
The idea was simple: Fezcodex is growing. With hundreds of blog posts, apps, and project logs, a standard list or grid view just wasn't cutting it anymore. I wanted a way to visualize the connections between everything. To see the "brain" of the website.

Read more...

item.title: Routing Revolution: SSG, BrowserRouter, and the SEO Fix
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Routing Revolution: SSG, BrowserRouter, and the SEO Fix

Read more...

item.title: The Art of the Algorithm: Generative Visuals in Fezcodex
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Art in the digital age isn't just about pixels and brushes; it's about rules, logic, and mathematics. In Fezcodex, I've integrated several "visual experiments" that turn code into aesthetics. From the subtle backgrounds of cards to full-blown design laboratories, let's explore how these algorithms work.

Read more...

item.title: Brutalist Fezcodex: The Big Cleanup
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Today was a huge day for Fezcodex. We did a "Major Refactor."

Read more...

item.title: Introducing New Reading Modes: Dossier and Terminal!
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Excited to unveil two brand new ways to experience content on Fezcodex Blogposts: Dossier Mode and Terminal Mode! These unique reading modes are designed to offer a fresh and engaging perspective, allowing you to tailor your browsing experience to your personal style.

Read more...

item.title: Typeface vs. Font: The Music Analogy
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
The easiest way to understand the difference is to think about music:

Read more...

item.title: Why Your Brain Hates Lyrics While You Work: The Irrelevant Speech Effect
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever tried to read a book while someone next to you is having a loud conversation on the phone? You probably found yourself reading the same sentence three times without understanding a word.

Read more...

item.title: React Magic: Rendering Components from Markdown Links
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Static text is boring. In a modern React application, your content should be alive.

Read more...

item.title: Implementing a Resizable Global Sliding Side Panel in React
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Sometimes, a modal is just too intrusive. You want to show detailed context—like a complex rating system or metadata—without forcing the user to lose their place on the page or blocking the entire UI with a backdrop that demands immediate attention. Enter the Sliding Side Panel.

Read more...

item.title: Building a Digital Rotary Phone
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
In a world of touchscreens and haptic feedback, there's something deeply satisfying about the mechanical click-whirrr of a rotary phone. I recently built a digital version of this retro interface for Fezcodex, and I want to take you through the engineering journey—from the trigonometry of the dial to the state management of the call logic.

Read more...

item.title: Nocturnote: A Sleek and Modern Text Editor
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Nocturnote: The Text Editor I Always Wanted

Have you ever felt like your text editor is either doing too much or too little? That's exactly how I felt before I started building Nocturnote.

Read more...

item.title: The Art of Recursive Botany: How Fractal Flora Works
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever wondered how nature creates such intricate and beautiful patterns, from the branching of trees to the delicate veins of a leaf? Much of this complexity can be explained by surprisingly simple rules, often involving fractals and recursion. Our new "Fractal Flora" app lets you explore these principles by growing your own digital trees with a few sliders.

Read more...

item.title: Unlocking Your Journey: Introducing the Fezcodex Achievement System!
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Here at Fezcodex, we believe exploration should be rewarded. That's why we're thrilled to unveil the brand-new Achievement System – a fun and engaging way to discover all the hidden corners and cool features of the site!

Read more...

item.title: Unlocking the Multiverse: New Visual Modes in Fezcodex
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Websites should be fun. While optimizing performance and fixing bugs is satisfying, sometimes you just want to flip the table -or in this case-, the entire viewport.

Read more...

item.title: Reducing React App Bundle Size: A Practical Guide
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Web performance is crucial for user experience. A slow-loading website can drive visitors away before they even see your content. Recently, I noticed that Fezcodex was taking a bit too long to load, so I decided to investigate and optimize the production build.

Read more...

item.title: Mastering Tailwind CSS: The "Absolute Centering" Trick
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever tried to center a title in a header, but also wanted a "Back" button or a breadcrumb on the far left?

Read more...

item.title: LeetCode 62: Unique Paths - A Dynamic Programming Approach
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
LeetCode 62, "Unique Paths," is a classic problem that often serves as an excellent introduction to dynamic programming. It challenges us to find the number of unique paths a robot can take to reach the bottom-right corner of a m x n grid, starting from the top-left corner. The robot can only move either down or right at any point in time.

Read more...

item.title: Gaussian Elimination: The Swiss Army Knife of Linear Systems in Computer Engineering
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
When you hear "linear algebra," your mind might jump to complex math, but at its heart lies a powerful tool called Gaussian Elimination. Far from being just a theoretical concept, this method is a workhorse in various fields of computer engineering, helping us solve systems of linear equations efficiently. In simple terms, it's a systematic way to solve multiple equations with multiple unknowns.

Read more...

item.title: Kaprekar's Routine: A Curious Number Game
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever played with numbers and found a surprising pattern? One such fascinating pattern is hidden within Kaprekar's Routine, named after the Indian mathematician D.R. Kaprekar. It's a simple game that, for most four-digit numbers, always leads to the same result: 6174.

Read more...

item.title: The Inevitable Dance of Entropy: A Rant on Chaos
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Samil Bulbul
item.content:encoded:
Oh, to be human! To crave order, to meticulously plan, to believe that if we just gather enough data, analyze enough variables, we can predict the future. What a glorious, self-deceiving delusion. Because lurking beneath our carefully constructed narratives of cause and effect, there's a mischievous, undeniable truth: Chaos Theory.

Read more...
